snippet: The agreement, which officials say is not to be replicated, would send some of the asylum seekers now detained on remote islands to the United States....
abstract: Australia and United Nations' refugee agency have reached one-time agreement to send some of refugees Australia had banished to detention centers on remote Pacific Islands to be resettled in United States; Australian policy of sending asylum-seekers to detention centers was long criticized for being illegal.

byline.original: By MICHELLE INNIS and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Michelle Innis reported from Sydney, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The agreement, which officials say is not to be replicated, would send some of the asylum seekers now detained on remote islands to the United States.

headline.main: U.N. Offers ‘One-Off’ Help to Australia in Resettling Refugees in U.S.
headline.print_headline: U.N. Offers Australia Help Settling Refugees in U.S.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations High Commission for Refugees
